data.title: Avalon GloboCare to conduct $9.75 million private placement; $3.25m upfront, up to $6.5m upon warrants exercise.
data.description: An initial payment of $3.25 million was made, with the potential for up to approximately $6.5 million in total proceeds upon the full exercise of warrants.

data.title: Nearly 20,000 wallets hold 100 BTC each in a 'bullish sign', with just 7 wallets needed to reach the milestone amid market uncertainty.
data.description: According to data from Santiment, only seven additional wallets are required to achieve a total of 20,000 holding a minimum of 100 Bitcoin each. This development comes during a period of persistent market instability.

data.title: Ademi Firm probes if NCR Atleos (NYSE: NATL) gets fair price in Brink's Co. deal - Shareholders urged to join investigation
data.description: In Milwaukee on February 26, 2026, Ademi LLP is conducting an investigation into NCR Atleos (NYSE: NATL) regarding potential breaches of fiduciary duty and legal violations related to its recent deal with Brink's Company. Individuals interested in participating in the investigation and gaining more information can click the link provided.

data.title: TCL Electronics (01070.HK) added to Hang Seng indices, reaffirming market position growth. - Value and growth potential solidified.
data.description: TCL Electronics Holdings Limited, a company traded as 01070.HK, has disclosed favorable news regarding its market position. The company's value and growth potential have been reaffirmed as it reaches new heights in the market. This announcement was made in Hong Kong on Feb. 26, 2026. The latest review results by Hang... have contributed to TCL Electronics' positive outlook.

data.title: Leading cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, Ethereum, XRP, Dogecoin slipped: BTC at $67,060.77 (-2.13%), ETH $2,007.51 (-2.60%), XRP $1.40 (-2.40%), Dogecoin $0.09678 (-4.29%). Concerns over potential market bottoms with U-turn observed, Bitcoin's market share at 58% and Ethereum's at 10.5%. Over $240 million liquidated in 24 hours, with Bitcoin's open interest down 2.39%. "Extreme Fear" sentiment in market per Crypto Fear & Greed Index.
data.description: Leading cryptocurrencies experienced a decline on Thursday as market uncertainties persisted. Bitcoin dropped by 2.13% to $67,060.77, Ethereum fell by 2.60% to $2,007.51, XRP decreased by 2.40% to $1.40, Solana declined by 3.97% to $85.44, and Dogecoin saw a 4.29% fall to $0.09678 in the 24-hour period. Bitcoin's trading volume decreased by 22%, with its market share at 58% and Ethereum's at 10.5%. Companies like Strategy Inc. and Coinbase Global Inc. saw their stock prices drop by 1.66% and 1.57%, respectively. Over $240 million was liquidated from the market in 24 hours, impacting bullish long traders. Bitcoin's open interest and sentiment were down, reflecting a market correction. Retail and whale investors on Binance remained long on Bitcoin positions. "Extreme Fear" sentiment prevailed as per the Crypto Fear & Greed Index.

data.title: QCY to launch Track S10 smartwatch for athletes, promises enhanced fitness with precision and power.
data.description: In Dongguan, China, on February 27, 2026, QCY introduced the QCY Track, a state-of-the-art sports smartwatch designed to elevate athletes' fitness experiences. Renowned for high-performance wearables, QCY has developed the QCY Track to cater to the precise needs of users seeking power and endurance in their workouts. This groundbreaking smartwatch is equipped with cutting-edge features that set it apart from the competition, making it the ultimate choice for athletes looking to enhance their training sessions.

data.title: Digital Dentistry Market to grow at 9.62% CAGR to reach USD 16.67 billion by 2031; Restorative Dentistry share at 34.54% in 2025.
data.description: In Hyderabad, India, a recent report from Mordor Intelligence indicates significant growth in the digital dentistry market. Starting at USD 9.61 billion in 2025, it is projected to rise to USD 10.53 billion in 2026, with further growth expected to reach USD 16.67 billion by 2031. This suggests a considerable compound annual growth rate over the forecast period.
